body: >17 In every province and city, wherever the king’s decree arrived, the Jews rejoiced and had a great celebration and declared a public festival and holiday. **And many of the people of the land became Jews themselves, for they feared what the Jews might do to them.**
body_html: 17 In every province and city, wherever the king’s decree arrived, the Jews rejoiced and had a great celebration and declared a public festival and holiday. And many of the people of the land became Jews themselves, for they feared what the Jews might do to them.

guild.description:
"For God so loved the world, that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him shall not perish, but have eternal life. For God did not send the Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world might be saved through Him. He who believes in Him is not judged; he who does not believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God. This is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their deeds were evil. For everyone who does evil hates the Light, and does not come to the Light for fear that his deeds will be exposed. But he who practices the truth comes to the Light, so that his deeds may be manifested as having been wrought in God."

May all personally encounter the presence and attention of the Lord God. 

Curiosity, questions, discussion, and prayer requests are welcome.

body: I don't see God mentioned anywhere here. In fact I don't see God mentioned in any of the surrounding couple of chapters. This looks like a narrative rather than teaching about Jewish supremacy. And many believe this book is a work of fiction.

body:
Ah yes, let us take verses out of context and make the Bible say what we want it to say! No one has ever tried that in all of history. Certainly not in Jesus time. There definitely weren't a specific group of people he frequently preached against who did exactly that. And the Satan certainly doesn't do that either. 

Weak sauce trolling, dude.

body: Out of context? The entire book of Esther is about a semi-religious slut acting in the interests of Jewish supremacy, manipulating Persian court in order to avoid a shoah. Esther is the true face of the Bible: a blatant attempt at subverting goyim by the Jews.
body_html: Out of context? The entire book of Esther is about a semi-religious slut acting in the interests of Jewish supremacy, manipulating Persian court in order to avoid a shoah. Esther is the true face of the Bible: a blatant attempt at subverting goyim by the Jews.

body:
>I don't see God mentioned anywhere here. 

Which is all the more important that you read this passage.

The fact that it made it to the final cut in the first place is very telling. Remember that the Bible is supposed to be the "Living Word of God".

There's also some important background information you should probably google up, such as actual historical records of Mordecai (expunged, leaving a very conspicuous historical gap, implying an absolutely horrible Prime Minister), and a certain saint named "Saint Esterica"
body_html:
I don't see God mentioned anywhere here.

Which is all the more important that you read this passage.

The fact that it made it to the final cut in the first place is very telling. Remember that the Bible is supposed to be the "Living Word of God".

There's also some important background information you should probably google up, such as actual historical records of Mordecai (expunged, leaving a very conspicuous historical gap, implying an absolutely horrible Prime Minister), and a certain saint named "Saint Esterica"

>I don't see God mentioned anywhere here. 

Which is all the more important that you read this passage.

The fact that it made it to the final cut in the first place is very telling. Remember that the Bible is supposed to be the "Living Word of God".

There's also some important background information you should probably google up, such as actual historical records of Mordecai (expunged, leaving a very conspicuous historical gap, implying an absolutely horrible Prime Minister), and a certain saint named "Saint Esterica"

This is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their deeds were evil. For everyone who does evil hates the Light, and does not come to the Light for fear that his deeds will be exposed. But he who practices the truth comes to the Light, so that his deeds may be manifested as having been wrought in God."

May all personally encounter the presence and attention of the Lord God.

guild.description:
"For God so loved the world, that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him shall not perish, but have eternal life. For God did not send the Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world might be saved through Him. He who believes in Him is not judged; he who does not believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God. This is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their deeds were evil. For everyone who does evil hates the Light, and does not come to the Light for fear that his deeds will be exposed. But he who practices the truth comes to the Light, so that his deeds may be manifested as having been wrought in God."

May all personally encounter the presence and attention of the Lord God. 

Curiosity, questions, discussion, and prayer requests are welcome.

body:
Continue practicing your Jewish Supremacy religion that does not tell you to help your fellow man, but that you are a worthless goyim who exists only to serve the Jewish race.

As I said, Esther is 100% raw, unfiltered Jewish Supremacist rhetoric that doesn't even attempt to hide behind the veneer of a "god". The fact that you did not completely disavow the book shows your true allegiance.
